Unknown.translation: There are several types of worldly loves but all these are false and considered a source of distress.

lines.gurmukhi: byd imrjwdw mY khq hY kQw Anyk; sunIAY n qYsI pRIiq mn mY n mwnIAY [

Unknown.translation: Several love episodes are found used in the Vedas in order to explain certain point but none is heard or believed to be anywhere near the love of a Sikh with his Guru and holy congregation.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: byd rIqI bydwˆ dI b`DI hoeI pRpwtI ivKy BI Anykwˆ khwxIAwˆ pRIqI sbMDI kihx ivc AOˆdIAwˆ hn pRMqU vrqmwn ivc nhIˆ suxIˆdI Eho jyhI pRIq dI Gtnw, iqsI pRkwr mn AMdr BI mMnn ivc nhIˆ Aw skdI Bwv, Sbd pRmwx qoˆ Cut pRq`K pRmwx vjoˆ koeI audwhrx nhIˆ imldw qy inscw BI nhIˆ b`Jdw[

lines.gurmukhi: igAwn aunmwn mY n jgq Bgq ibKY; rwg nwd bwid Awid AMiq hU n jwnIAY [

Unknown.translation: Such true love cannot be found in methods and statements of knowledge, in saying of pious persons in the melodies sung in various modes with accompaniment of musical instruments from one end of world to the other.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: igAwn aunmwn ivKy Bwv Anumwn pRmwx dÍwry dlIlwˆ dy GoVy duVw aukq jukq clw ky BI q`ikAwˆ nhIˆ jwnx ivc AOˆdI AYsI koeI pRIqI Awid AMq ivKy jgq AMdr AQvw BgqI mwrg dy dwhÍydwrwˆ AMdr, ijhVy ik rwg Alwpdy, sRodwˆ auTwˆdy qw Folkwˆ CYxy KVqwlwˆ KMjIrwˆ Awid swj bwj dy pswry pswrdy hn[

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK sMgiq imlwp ko pRqwpu jYso; qYso n iqRlok ibKy Aaur aur AwnIAY [188[

Unknown.translation: The expression of love between the Sikhs and the holy congregation of the True Guru has unique grandeur and such love cannot find its match in anyone's heart in the three worlds. (188)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: s`cmu`c shI gurU Aru is`K sMgq dy imlwp ipAwr dw pRqwp ijs pRkwr dw hY, Eho jyhw nhIˆ iqRlokI ivKy hor iksy itkwxy pRwpq ho skdw ]188]
